org.jscsi.parser.datasegment

Class AbstractDataSegment

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jscsi.parser.datasegment.AbstractDataSegment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDataSegment

    public abstract class AbstractDataSegment
extends Object
implements IDataSegment

    DataSegment

    This class represents a basic interface for a data segment contained in a ProtocolDataUnit object.

    Author:
    Volker Wildi

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected ByteBuffer dataBuffer
      The buffer of this data segment.
      protected int length
      The number of bytes actually used by the dataBuffer.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractDataSegment

        public AbstractDataSegment(int initMaxChunkSize)
        Constructor to create a new, empty DataSegment object with the given chunk size.
        Parameters:
        initMaxChunkSize - The maximum size (in bytes) of one chunk, which represents the MaxRecvDataSegmentLength.

    • Method Detail

      • serialize

        public int serialize(ByteBuffer dst,
            int off)
        This method exports the data buffer to the given ByteBuffer object, which is padded to a integer number of 4 byte words.
        Specified by:
        serialize in interface IDataSegment
        Parameters:
        dst - Destination ByteBuffer object.
        off - Start position in dst, where to serialize.
        Returns:
        The number of exported bytes (in bytes).

      • getSettings

        public SettingsMap getSettings()
                        throws InternetSCSIException
        Returns a SettingsMap instance of this IDataSegment instance. This is only useful with a TextParameterDataSegment instance.
        Specified by:
        getSettings in interface IDataSegment
        Returns:
        The settings of this TextParameterDataSegment instance.
        Throws:
        InternetSCSIException - if any violation of the iSCSI Standard occurs.

      • getTotalLength

        public static final int getTotalLength(int len)
        Returns the total length (with padding), which is needed for the given length len.
        Parameters:
        len - The length of the DataSegment, which want to be stored.
        Returns:
        The total length.

      • resizeBuffer

        protected void resizeBuffer(int additionalLength,
                boolean copyData)
        This method resizes the data buffer, if necessary. A resizing is not needed, when the neededLength is greater than the capacity of allocated data buffer. The flag copyData indicates, if the old buffer has to be copied into the new bigger data buffer.
        Parameters:
        additionalLength - The length, which is now needed to store all informations in the data buffer.
        copyData - true, if old buffer has to be copied into the new buffer. false indicates, that the new buffer is initialized with zeros.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears all made settings of this object. After the call of this method, this object can be reused.
        Specified by:
        clear in interface IDataSegment

      • getLength

        public final int getLength()
        Returns the length, which is really used by the dataBuffer.
        Specified by:
        getLength in interface IDataSegment
        Returns:
        The really used length.

      • setDataBuffer

        public final int setDataBuffer(ByteBuffer src,
                int off,
                int len)
        Sets the data buffer to the given buffer src. Starting from the position offset with length of len.
        Specified by:
        setDataBuffer in interface IDataSegment
        Parameters:
        src - The buffer to read from.
        off - The start offset to read from.
        len - The number of bytes to read.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes really read.

      • calcPadding

        protected static final int calcPadding(int len)
        This methods calculates the number of padding bytes of the given length. This number of the padding bytes is in the range of 0, ..., BYTES_PER_INT.
        Parameters:
        len - The length for which the padding bytes are calculated.
        Returns:
        The number of padding bytes.
